body.p:
Rockport Ind Apr the 3/65
Govenor
H. Bramlett
Sir

I take the pleasure of informing you that I desire commission for captain to Recruit for a company of volenteers for the state of Kentucky for the term of one year if get commissions will Recruit in Grayson County I had to Leave my home on the account of the gurrillers Some of my friends wrote to me a few days ago that if I wood come wood Raise a company for me was Born & Raised in Grayson Co Ky
was Born June the 27 day 1834 if granted commission Exspect to commence as soon as possible I Shall anxiously await your Letter
Direct your Letter to Rockport Ind

answered
April 11th
Chas. S. Peyton,
Rockport, Ind.
Grayson
Rockport Ind.
April 3. 1865
Peyton Charles S.
To The Gov.
Ans. by Ins. General,
April 11/65, Letter Book B.
Desires authority to raise a Co. of state troops for Grayson County-
Adj Generals Office Ky
April 11" 1865
Respectfully referred to Maj W H Hays. Inspt Genl Ky with instructions that the state is not raising troops, Except as contemplated in the recent law.

By order of the Gov
D. W. Lindsey

Adj Genl Ky
L B No 11- 1865 P 368
Recd A. G. O. Ky 8 April 1865
